name: Grand Hotel Bristol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week, returning home on Saturday 13th July. The whole experience, booked with Crystal, was efficient and matched our expectations. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location. Although we stayed at the back, the noise from delivery vehicles was minimal. The food was excellent and we would be very happy to return. It would be great if these hotels could be persuaded to offer free WiFi but this seems to be part of a wider problem.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and helpful
reviews.title: Hotel it may be,but Grand it ain't

reviews.text: Arriving at 16.00hrs after all day traveling we were presented with our keycard for Room 550 and to our surprise (we were expecting 4 star standards) it was not big enough to swing a cat. The room had a 'cheap quasi antique' style single wardrobe with just 2 internal drawers which stuck out into the room by about 2ft. The 2 small single beds pushed together with one side pushed up against a table with 2 chairs pushed under and would have been impossible to use. The bed head had control panels one for each bed for various things, the only thing that worked was the switch for the bedside light. The bathroom was so small if you bent over the sink e.g. to brush your teeth, your bottom touched the wall on the opposite side.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in Stresa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After trying to fit all our clothes for a 10 day stay my wife just broke down in tears and said we can't stay here.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel on our tour

reviews.text: After going back to reception they agreed to change rooms to Room 660(bigger in size but similar decor quasi antique) it was in the annex (or as we called it the punishment block) a good 4 mins walk, or a ride on a horizontal elevator which you can walk faster, from reception/restaurant /swimming pool/bar etc, don't forget anything you need. We were sent back to pack our cases to move and then go to reception to change keycards, whilst packing our bags the phone rang 'How much longer are you going to be'?' '2 more minutes ' I replied, a grunt was the reply to that.
reviews.title: Lives up to its name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the Grand Hotel Bristol our instant impression was "Wow"! From the front it looks very imposing. Through the revolving door, up to the grand reception - impressive. On to our room; the view was amazing, right down the full length of Lake Maggiore, and we had a lovely balcony where we had breakfast on several mornings. However, behind the veneer the hotel is clinging to faded glories. Little things were not quite right. Although our room was adequate, the furniture was antequated, the air conditioning only went so low and then no futher, and although we had a shower fitment we had no shower screen! So we showered very carefully so as not to soak the whole bathroom! The staff were really helpfull and friendly but, appart from breakfast, we only ate in the restaurant once, for dinner. The food was OK but no more. We enjoyed our stay, but we left feeling that with a good bit of refurbishment this hotel could pass from being OK to being truly wonderful. Someone needs to take it by the scruff of the neck and bring it into the 21st Century........... please!
reviews.title: The Curate's Egg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for seven nights here at Lake Maggiore on the 12th to the 19th July, 2013 with a major holiday company..
reviews.title: A grand hotel indeed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a 4* and it didn't disappoint us. We had no problems. The hotel is well staffed, comfortable and ideally located being only a slow 10 mins walk from the town centre.The staff were very professional and smartly dressed in the hotel uniforms and I can see that some people may perceive this as cold or unfriendly as mentioned in some previous reviews but despite this, we found all the staff treated us as special quests and in particularly the restaurant staff who treated us as individuals had a laugh with us, were friendly and gave excellent service throughout making our stay and holiday more special. Breakfast and evening meals was always something to look forward to each day. We stayed half board but there are plenty of excellent places to eat in town. The hotel food was very good indeed and all appeared to be fresh and cooked excellently. The weather was hot and sunny during our stay, so we ate outside on the large terrace for Breakfast and Dinner with a lake view; wonderful but you can eat inside if you prefer as the dining rooms were very large and had plenty of tables and space. Breakfast was buffet style, plentiful and a lots of variety with the usual hot and cold items, juices; tea and coffee served at your table. The evening meal was always a four courses, H'orderves (buffet, help yourself), four choices from the menu for your next two courses (served) followed by dessert again from the buffet and help yourself. All the food was good and always had a choice of fish, meat and a veg option. The wine was good and reasonably priced. We always went for 1/2 a bottle of house red/white at 11 Euro's which was adequate. A full bottle was 19 euro's which you could make last over two nights as the staff will keep it chilled for you for the next meal. You can ask for a jug of ordinary tap water with ice without any additional charge or the usual push to purchase bottled water at some extortionate price as is often the case with some hotels. However, if you prefer bottled water at a charge that is also available. Sorry, I don't know the price. The room we had (232) was spacious and well equipped with a safe, TV with the usual, Sky, CNN, BBC World, True Entertainment and assorted channels, extra pillows and blankets.We had two balconies, a double and single with three tables and six chairs to ourselves as the room was at the end on the corner of the hotel with one balcony looking over the hotel grounds and outdoor pool and the other with a lake view, brilliant. The bathroom was good with a bath/shower, bidet, sink toilet with hairdryer and shaver socket, etc. The room was clean and cleaned daily with fresh sheets, etc.All the pool and spa facilities and gardens were immaculate and clean. We only used the bar once as the drinks we a bit pricey but you expect that at a hotel like this.
reviews.title: Stresa and Maggiore fantastic, good hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, the room was quiet and we slept well but the hotel does sit on the main road along with all the other major hotels and is directly opposite the lake. The railway also runs along the back all be it well away from the hotel. Soooo, outside noise (road traffic, boat/launch engines and very slightly in the distance the trains) can be expected during the day but quietens down at night and is hardly noticeable if all the windows are shut as it is all double glazed. We didn't find the noise intrusive at all after the first night and I'm a light sleeper. However, as mentioned by other reviewers, if it is unbearably hot at night as it can be in Italy and your air-con doesn't work properly or is switched off and you need to sleep with the windows open, then it could be an issue but I have stayed in worse in the past where the noise as been very penetrating and a problem with sleepless nights; so I wouldn't bother too much about it. The hotel is nicely decorated and comfortable, near all amenities and the town without the noise as such.......loved the place.. I would recommend and stay again at this hotel.
reviews.title: Scenic Stresa

reviews.text: Now, the Lakes area is lovely and the views are not to be missed but some of the trip excursions provided by the holiday companies can be very expensive these days and don't appear to be value for money as tour guides and transport is expensive. If you want go to nearby Lake Orta (known as the little Jewel in the Crown of the lakes) for the day then make your own way using the public S A F bus to Orta and back to Stresa (it doesn't go anywhere else). The bus leaves Stresa, from the Piazzo Marconi Main Square in town. The Bus Stop/Terminus is where the (Dotto Train tours pick-up) easy to find and use for just 3,05 Euro's single; 38 Euro's each using the Holiday company mmmmmmmm!!!. Orta is a small beautiful town by the lake (3 hours to do the lot) and the Tour company can't do anything more by coach than the public bus does and they want 38 Euro's. The public S A F bus leaves Stresa at 10 am ( it seems very reliable as others from the hotel had discovered this little gem of a service) takes an hour over the top of mountain and drops down on the other side; lovely little trip and leaves Orta at 15.00pm or 18.00pm, please yourself for 6,10 Euro's and a spot of lunch. Chou!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful position, and excellent service
Very close to perfection.
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Stresa on Lake Maggiore. The Grand Hotel Bristol was recommended by our local travel agent. It was everything we had hoped it would be for our one week stay. The public areas are spacious and pleasant. Our third floor bedroom had a lake view and was well appointed. The staff, without exception, were pleasant, courteous and extremely helpful. The restaurant was quite outstanding. Whether it was breakfast or an evening meal, the quality of the food was always exceptional. A pleasant surprise was the wine list which included a substantial number of very acceptable reasonably priced bottles. The only minor disappointment was that the bathroom, which was a little on the small size. However, this in no way was a major issue. This hotel has our unreserved recommendation.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: Stayed in stresa at this wonderful hotel for a week in early June. This hotel exceeded my expectations as I was a little concerned about service having read some previous reviews. The service , in my opinion, was excellent particularly in the dining room. Well done to the waiters who were very friendly and efficient . The food was first class particularly the salad buffet which was a meal in itself. Our lake view room was comfortable with wonderful views over the garden and pool up towards the mountains. Having stayed at the Regina palace last year I expected the Bristol to be similar but the service and overall experience was much better. Well done grand hotel Bristol you've got my vote!

Stresa is a beautifulk place to spend a few days. I was there for a business conference, and the hotel was convenient for that purpose. Negatives would be that it is a bit old and needs brushing up a bit. I also wa snot happy with airconditioning ins ome meeting rooms.
reviews.title: Good athmosphere, nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that the food was good, however not to varied. Fascilities are what you need. I recomend s stroll down to the centre of Stresa to taste the local cuisine.
reviews.title: Not quite what it appears to be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm struggling to rate this hotel. As you approach it from the road it is undoubtedly a "Grand Hotel" but as soon as you enter the hotel it almost feels like a museum piece. A Grand Hotel of a prior era. It has been many (many) years since I last saw telephone booths in a hotel lobby and there was some truly bizarre decor on offer such as an enormous jade stone ship.
reviews.title: Grand but of a different era.

reviews.text: Starting with the positives, the location is stunning, just a few steps from the lakefront, looking straight across to Isola Bella and about a 10 minute walk along the promenade to the centre of the town. The gardens and outdoor pool are absolutely gorgeous and with the poolside bar it is very easy to get drinks or a bite to eat.
reviews.title: Italian Style - Stresa and the Gran Hotel Bristol

reviews.text: Moving to the negatives, as mentioned the decor is very dated and in some places this is actually starting to look rather tired. The bedroom had a beautiful balcony looking over the pool and towards the lake but again, it was clearly last decorated in the 1980's and had a tin bath with chipped enamel. The indoor pool area (which is reached by the most bizarre side-ways moving elevator I've ever come across) was rather shabby with mould on parts of the wall and ceiling. This is surely a cheap fix which begs the question why it's gone unnoticed. The outdoor pool, whilst beautiful was absolutely freezing to the point where were it not exceptionally hot outside the pool would have been unusable. The final negative is the WiFi. Very few hotels still charge for this whilst at the Bristol be prepared to spend a fortune if you want to use it.
reviews.title: Very old hotel, not recommended!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been heavily involved in the hotel industry for the last 20 years I've seen how this industry has developed to meet the needs of the modern traveller. This hotel would have been considered old fashioned when I first entered the business, these days it's practically a relic and so clearly crying out for investment which I suspect the owners cannot afford.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our second trip to Lake Maggiore and our second stay at the Gran Hotel Bristol. This time we took advantage of a late deal and as such we were allocated a side lake view room (our previous room had a full lake view, but then we paid for the privilege). Having read some of the reviews I really don't know what people expect - the beds are very comfortable and the room spotlessly clean with nice quality furnishings and traditional décor - but it is not depressing. If you want bling or minimalist décor then the Bristol is not for you (nor would I suggest are 90% of the hotels in the Italian Lakes). Breakfast is very good with a hot and cold buffet offering everything from cold meats and cheeses, cereals, fruit and yoghurts to pancetta, eggs, sausages and tomatoes plus a huge variety of breads, cakes and croissants, all accompanied by freshly squeezed orange juice and good quality coffee. We hired a car at Bergamo and so did not eat any other meals at the hotel as we were able to sample various restaurants around Lake Maggiore and beyond; but for those who did the table d’hôte menu was 38 Euros.
reviews.title: Just brilliant

description: The strikingly elegant Grand Hotel Bristol is set amidst beautifully tended gardens and has a wonderful view over the lake and Borromean Island at the foot of the Alps. Conveniently situated across the road from the lake, and only 300 metres from the centre of Stresa, the hotel’s large swimming pool is set in the immaculate grounds and shares the panoramic view of the lake and mountains. There is also an indoor pool at your disposal with two hot tubs.
